hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ led us in the Zuhr prayer with five rakats. Then a man called Dhu al-Shimaalayn stood and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, has something been added to the prayer?' He said: 'What is that?' He said: 'You led us in five rakats.' Then the Prophet ﷺ turned toward the qibla, performed the takbir while sitting, and prostrated two prostrations in which there was recitation and no bowing, and said: 'These are the humiliating ones.' Zayd ibn Ali said regarding a man who forgets to stand and sits instead, or stands when he should sit: 'He owes two prostrations of forgetfulness.' [Further rulings of Zayd ibn Ali regarding various prayer errors and their remedies are detailed...]

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: Umar led the people in the Fajr prayer while he was in a state of ritual impurity. When he finished the prayer, he turned to the people and said: 'O people, indeed Umar led you in prayer while he was ritually impure.' The people said: 'What do you command, O Commander of the Believers?' He said: 'I must repeat, but there is no need for you to repeat.' Then Ali said: 'Nay, rather you and they must repeat. Do you not see that the people follow their Imam? They enter when he enters, they exit when he exits, they bow when he bows, they prostrate when he prostrates. If an error occurs to him, it occurs to those behind him.' So some people followed Ali's view and some followed Umar's view.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: Make what you caught with the Imam the first of your prayer. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about the interpretation of that. He said: If you caught one rakat of the prayer with the Imam while he was in Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, or Isha, add another rakat to it, then recite the tashahhud and this is the second for you, and recite in it what was missed from you, as it was obligatory on the Imam to recite. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who catches one rakat with the Imam when the Imam has prostrations of forgetfulness to perform. He said: He prostrates with him and does not recite the salutation. When the Imam finishes from the two prostrations of forgetfulness, he stands and makes up what the Imam preceded him in.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: Do not abandon two rakats after Maghrib, whether in journey or at home, because they are the Word of Allah the Mighty and Majestic: 'And after prostration' (Quran 50:40). And do not abandon two rakats after sunrise before the obligatory prayer, in journey or at home, because they are His Word the Mighty and His Remembrance the Majestic: 'And after the stars' (Quran 52:49). I asked Zayd ibn Ali about praying one rakat before sunrise and one rakat after sunrise. He said: 'Repeat them, because they are both after sunrise.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ never prayed the Duhaa prayer except on the day of the Conquest of Makkah, for he prayed it on that day with two rakats. And the Prophet ﷺ said: 'I sought permission from my Lord regarding the opening of Makkah and He permitted me to open it for one hour of the day, then He closed it, and He did not permit it for anyone before me, and He will not permit it for anyone after me. So it is forbidden as long as the heavens and the earth remain.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: During the reign of Umar, he was asked about the night prayer of a man in his house and his recitation of the Quran - what is its reward? He said: O Abu al-Hasan, were you not a witness when I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? I said: Yes. He said: Then report to me what the Messenger of Allah ﷺ answered me, for you are more preserving of it than I am. I said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'The night prayer is a light by which you illuminate your house.'
